page.title: 13FARM LABOUR + CONSERVATION
page.content: {THE FARM LABOURERS.}THE FARM STUDIED HAD 11 WORKERS AND A MANAGER. MOST OF THESE WERE TRACTOR DRIVERS. THEY TRAVELLED IN FROM SURROUNDING TOWNS AND VILLAGES, THE FARM COTTAGES HAVE BEEN SOLD OFF. THEY WORK A BASIC 40 HOUR WEEK PLUS OVERTIME FOR WHICH THEY ARE PAID Â£ 2.00 PLUS PER HOUR. { {CONSERVATION.}EVIDENCE WAS RECORDED WHERE FARMERS HAD IMPROVED HABITATS. ON THE FARM WE STUDIED PONDS HAD BEEN CLEARED, HEDGEROWS HAD BEEN LEFT TO GROW TALLER IN SOME AREAS AND 2ha. OF WOODLAND HAD BEEN PLANTED. IT WAS NOTED HOWEVER THAT MANY HEDGEROWS HAD BEEN REMOVED. ONE FIELD OF 32ha. HAD ONCE BEEN 7 SEPARATE FIELDS. GREAT CARE WAS TAKEN IN THE USE OF FARM CHEMICALS AND IN THE PREVENTION OF POLLUTION BY SUCH SUBSTANCES AS SILAGE EFFLUENT.
